content.question: For <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> hours, the velocity of a ship is modeled by <math alttext="v of t equals, the fraction with numerator 1,530, and denominator t squared, minus 24 t, plus 172, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1530</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>24</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>172</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></math> miles per hour. What is the average velocity of the ship, in miles per hour, from <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="t equals 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></math> hours?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
